What is the address for "the show"

"Hey Now..."

> On Dec 29, 2016, at 8:1=
3 PM, Adam Trionfo ballyalley@... [ballyalley] <ballyalley@yahoogro=
ups.com> wrote:
> 
> I first began listening to podcasts about a year and a=
 half ago.  Chris, my former co-host, suggested The 2600 Game by Game Podca=
st.  I've still not caught up on all those episodes, but I'm getting close.=
  One of my favorite parts of any podcast, especially Ferg's podcast, are t=
he Christmas/holiday memories that people share.  I've heard all sorts of g=
reat Atari holiday-related stories, but for some reason Ferg has been suppr=
essing all the stories when people "boo" the Atari and are gung ho for the =
Bally.  It tell ya-- it's a conspiracy.  (Okay, it might be all in my head!=
)
> 
> I'm sure that there must be some Bally Arcade/Astrocade stories out =
there.  If you're one of those few people who got a Bally Arcade under the =
Christmas tree on Christmas Day, then I'd love to hear your story.  Maybe t=
he Bally was your only system.  Or, perhaps you already had an Atari and yo=
u pitted the two systems against each other.  Maybe you got a Bally Arcade =
very early (in January 1978) before the Atari VCS was king of America's liv=
ing rooms.  Or, maybe you got it as a gift while it was on clearance in 198=
4 for $25.  Do you have a sad tale to tell that involves asking for an Astr=
ocade, but you got an Atari instead?  Were you were up all night crying abo=
ut what might have been?  Possibly you have a four-player tale of playing 9=
9 rounds of Checkmate against your parents and little sister on Christmas m=
orning.
> 
> If your tale is holiday related (Christmas, Hanukkah, or whate=
ver you celebrate), then I'd love to hear it!  Please write in (email the s=
how) and tell us all about it.  If you're one of those awesome folks who li=
kes to record audio feedback, then that's welcome too.
> 
> The next episod=
e of the Astrocast will feature this holiday feedback in the December (okay=
, more like mid-January) episode.
> 
> I can't wait to hear your tales!
> 
=
> Adam
> 

--Apple-Mail-3E706072-B4A6-43CE-BCFB-D36326F47C20

<br><br>"Hey Now..."</div><div><br>On Dec 29, 2016, at 8:13 PM, Adam Trionf=
o <a href=3D"mailto:ballyalley@...">ballyalley@...</a> [bal=

=








 

<span style=3D"display:none"> </span>



    <div id=3D"ygr=
p-text">
      
      
      <p>


</p><div id=3D"divtagdefaultwrapper" sty=
le=3D"font-size:12pt;color:#000000;font-family:Calibri,Arial,Helvetica,sans=
-serif;" dir=3D"ltr">
<p></p>
<div>I first began listening to podcasts abou=
t a year and a half ago.  Chris, my former co-host, suggested The 2600=
 Game by Game Podcast.  I've still not caught up on all those episodes=
, but I'm getting close.  One of my favorite parts of any podcast, esp=
ecially
 Ferg's podcast, are the Christmas/holiday memories that people sha=
re.  I've heard all sorts of great Atari holiday-related stories, but =
for some reason Ferg has been suppressing all the stories when people "boo"=
 the Atari and are gung ho for the Bally.  It
 tell ya-- it's a conspi=
racy.  (Okay, it might be all in my head!)<br>
<br>
I'm sure that ther=
e must be some Bally Arcade/Astrocade stories out there.  If you're on=
e of those few people who got a Bally Arcade under the Christmas tree on Ch=
ristmas Day, then I'd love to hear your story.  Maybe the Bally was yo=
ur only system.  Or, perhaps
 you already had an Atari and you pitted =
the two systems against each other.  Maybe you got a Bally Arcade very=
 early (in January 1978) before the Atari VCS was king of America's living =
rooms.  Or, maybe you got it as a gift while it was on clearance in 19=
84
 for $25.  Do you have a sad tale to tell that involves asking for =
an Astrocade, but you got an Atari instead?  Were you were up all nigh=
t crying about what might have been?  Possibly you have a four-player =
tale of playing 99 rounds of Checkmate against your
 parents and little sis=
ter on Christmas morning.<br>
<br>
If your tale is holiday related (Christm=
as, Hanukkah, or whatever you celebrate), then I'd love to hear it!  P=
lease write in (email the show) and tell us all about it.  If you're o=
ne of those awesome folks who likes to record audio feedback, then that's w=
elcome
 too.<br>
<br>
The next episode of the Astrocast will feature this h=
oliday feedback in the December (okay, more like mid-January) episode.<br>
=
<br>
I can't wait to hear your tales!<br>
<br>
Adam<br>
</div>
<p></p>
</di=
